comments.body: Nit: Worth adding a ballpark range for the window value? I.e. is it minutes, 10s of minutes, etc...

the window is not specific right now, 30s is too tight.  2x30s was still not perfect based on @liggitt past attempts, but trying 3x30s to see if we can still ensure the function works while we work out more precise SLA for kubelet deleting the pod from the API server.
Gotcha! Could be helpful to have that info in the commit message or as a comment so someone looking at this in the future doesn't need to return to the pr description.

diffHunk:

			Testname: Pods, delete grace period
			Description: Create a pod, make sure it is running. Using the http client send a 'delete' with gracePeriodSeconds=30. Pod SHOULD get terminated within gracePeriodSeconds and removed from API server within a window.
		*/
		ginkgo.It("should be submitted and removed", func() {

comments.body: Nit: Worth adding a brief description, either here or in the commit message, around how we arrived at 3 as the multiplier?

after adding namespace, I realized the pod name contains a random uuid, so probably not necessary?

> name := "pod-submit-remove-" + string(uuid.NewUUID())
If we're going to change the description, it might as well make sense. What should be set on Pods?

In this case, "Pods Set QOS Class".  In the full test name (Describe + Context etc.) as used by the generated conformance docs this would show up (see https://github.com/cncf/k8s-conformance/blob/master/docs/KubeConformance-1.11.md#pods-set-qos-class-should-be-submitted-and-removed).  Perhaps the `KubeDescribe` above should use `Pod QOS Class` instead

The "normalized" test name that ends up in conformance.txt ends up just being the `It` with tags stripped.  This is why [I'm wondering if we want to change what we put in that list](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/78710#issuecomment-499184756)
